article_title: Medicare Penalizes Hospitals With High Patient Harm Rates
article_text:
Medicare Penalizes Hospitals With High Patient Harm Rates

Law360, New York (December 19, 2014, 4:26 PM ET) -- Hundreds of hospitals will see reductions in their Medicare payments in fiscal 2015 due to poor grades in preventing accidental harm to patients, according to data released by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services on Thursday.



Hospital-acquired conditions, or HACs, including infections, ulcers and adverse drug reactions, are “reasonably preventable conditions that patients did not have upon admission to a hospital but developed during the hospital stay,” according to a CMS statement.
